entry.et: Middle English trewe, from Old English trēowe faithful; akin to Old High German gitriuwi faithful, Old Irish derb sure, and probably to Sanskrit dāruṇa hard, dāru wood tree

def.dt: :being in accordance with the actual state of affairs true description
:fully realized or fulfilled dreams come true
:being that which is the case rather than what is manifest or assumed the true dimension of the problem
:properly so called true love the true faith the true stomach of ruminant mammals
:possessing the basic characters of and belonging to the same natural group as a whale is a true but not a typical mammal
:legitimate rightful our true and lawful king
:that is fitted or formed or that functions accurately
:determined with reference to the earth's axis rather than the magnetic poles true north
:without deviation the bullet flew straight and true
:the quality or state of being accurate (as in alignment or adjustment) used in the phrases in true and out of true
:to make level, square, balanced, or concentric :bring or restore to a desired mechanical accuracy or form true up a board true up an engine cylinder
:a person who professes absolute belief in something
:a zealous supporter of a particular cause
:a bill of indictment endorsed by a grand jury as warranting prosecution of the accused

entry.et: from the association of blue with constancy

def.dt: :marked by unswerving loyalty (as to a party)
:a test consisting of a series of statements to be marked as true or false
